job_title: Lead Staffing Coordinator in Williamsville, NY
pros: Good benefits & average salary
cons: This position is a revolving door at Millard Fillmore Suburban. Little to no training, very poor leadership, regular union vs company disputes that put you in the middle, & no opportunities to move up. They don't want to improve their processes or to use better available technology. And in this position, you are the escape dog for anything & everything that goes wrong in their mess of a system. On top of everything else, the pandemic hit & they still refused to look at simple, available technology to protect their non-medical staff. There are many better companies to work for than this one!!!

pros: Ive been working for  Kaleida Health Women and Childrens Hospital  for 14 years now as an R.N.  They have Good PTO accrual. Since Jody came in we are seeing changes for the better albeit slowly. Id still like a lot of things addressed however.
cons: Employees never get the recognition that they deserve. You can catch something that literally saves a childs life and not even get a "good job" from your boss. Its ridiculous! As far as retirement....its awful apparently we are looking at  300 bucks a month and thats with no health care at all. So baically ill have spent my entire life taking care of sick people at Kaleida and Kaleida wont take care of us when we retire medically? Disgusting. Also the safe patient ratios change every day (no joke, it seriously is everyday) based on whats convenient for Kaleida. Someone calls in and you have to take 5 or 6 patients instead of the 4 that is the "safe ratio" they tell you to "suck it up"

review_title: Proud to be associated because: patient centeredness, clinical excellence & best practices and customer satisfaction.
job_title: Manager of Imaging Services in Buffalo, NY
pros: On-boarding process was very positive an valuable asset.  Administration's visibility and supportive to management is outstanding and extends to the workforce.  Celebrations are supported and encouraged.
cons: Administration needs to support management  work and life balance....unable to use all PTO due to frequent change in deadlines on reports, projects and or other work related issues.    Provide Management perks to identify them as leaders.  As management there was fear of lay-off regardless of your experience, competencies and positive evaluations

review_title: Kaleida is on the upward swing
pros: Good Compensation, Has a very hopeful future. Great Benefits. There is a lot of opportunity to grow and develop professionally. Kaleida has newer leadership and they seem to be focusing on the culture by ways of individual growth and development- Leading with Care.
cons: It is a very large organization. It sometimes take way too long to accomplish some goals because there are too many people involved in decisions or are part of the process. There are always a few that make the work environment more difficult than it needs to be. When making a decision a lot of times people only see their department or their area and can not see the big picture- lack of vision. I find this frustrating

pros: I gaineded experience I very much appreciated.
cons: I wish the organization had a program in place that would better allow for utilization of in-house talent allowing for retention of valued employees. Talented employees should have the opportunity to grow and obtain new positions. Also, due to this being a union environment, some union rules applied to non-union employees. The problem with this is that not all union rules apply to non-union employees and this creates a confusing environment. For instance there was a seniority rule for union employees which assisted senior employees in obtaining new positions. This seniority rule was not available to non-union employees. They did however use discipline procedures that were union based. This creates and environment for non-union employees that is confusing and unfair.

review_title: It would be a better place to work if management knew what they were doing.
pros: The pay is good and the benefits are also good.
cons: mangement is not trained properly for the positions they are in.  All sites run differently, there is no consistency between the sites.  There is a lot of "dead weight", people that do not do their jobs, but collect a check every two weeks.  There is no discipline for poor work.

review_title: Passion for the patients, workforce and my leadership & management position
job_title: Manager of Imaging Services in Buffalo, NY
pros:
Administration supported celebrating workforce contribution, process improvements & re-engineering and delivery of patient care.

cons:
Deadlines changed often with limited turn around time to meet deadline change.
Difficult time taking all of PTO time- often lost PTO time
Management was not allowed to roll over PTO more than 40hrs into next year.
Work and life balance was more on work side.
Middle management constant risk for lay-off regardless how well you performed

job_title: Anesthesia Assistant in North Tonawanda, NY
pros: its a small town place to work. people are treated like they are coming to a hotel. i love the honesty that kaleida shares information with us employees. and they honestly want to know what we want and .need to do our jobs for 100 percent satisfaction to our community staff and patients as well as their families
cons: we are involved with other kaleida facilities and its hard to maintain small town service in a big company.

review_title: Great Job if you have zero initiative
pros: Compensation is ok as are benefits.  I wasn't a nurse and I think that maybe a different picture than what I portray below - but everyone I know who's been there and gone have been much happier after they've moved on, so take that for whatever it's worth.
cons:
If you're a go getter who asks a lot of questions and wants to get things done, you'll hate it here!  Where I worked upper management seemed afraid of smart, innovative people who wanted to be more efficient and cost effective.  In the rare cases where feedback and opinions were asked for, while they'd often acknowledge a great idea you'd never be allowed to follow through on it.  On a few occasions I did see where truly YEARS later changes were finally implemented but the person who's idea it was originally never got any credit or acknowledgement ... 

Other than management that were too afraid of bright staff there were also LOTS of staff who were constantly playing the CYA game - this seemed to be ingrained for long tenured employees (15-20 yrs +) because my observation was that if they were good at their job it wasn't like someone else was eyeing it, yet many of the administrative staff acted as if everyone was after their job.  Where I worked staff were super territorial and not welcoming in the least of new staff or ideas ... really just a depressing work environment that I'm glad to be rid of

pros: The medical corrridore is progressing nicely and looks very impressive.  The GVI is a beautiful addition to the Buffalo archetectual landscape.
cons: Unrealistic expectations of management.  We watch in fear as former managerial stars are escorted out and wonder when it will be our turn.  We wear far too many hats and are tole to "sell" unrealistic goals to our staff.  Sometimes think management should unionize!

review_title: I liked my job, my boss, my co-workers but I was laid off due to business conditions.
job_title: IT Department Tech in Buffalo, NY
pros: My immediate boss gives workers ample opportunity for growth and advancement. He allowed us to make judgement calls without micro-managing his employees. I feel he is an exceptionally good manager.
cons: The health insurance is expensive and requires a lot of high co-pays. It is a lousy plan and gets worse every couple of years when the company switches to yet another health insurance company. One would think a hospital corporation would have good health care for their empoloyees!

pros: Good pay, excellent benefits. Some very good/smart people to work with.
cons:
Non union long term employees here today gone tomorrow. Too political, management to worried about making themselves look good to executive team and don't care about their employees. Employee's do not get enough credit.
Constantly changing, very little communication.

review_title: Good company, but HR is too busy putting out fires to offer comprehensive succession plan.

cons: Stodgy culture, unions can generate a contentious and slow paced work environment, people are generally reactive and not proactive when facing problems

review_title: Kaleida Health is a great place to work.
job_title: Chart Acquisition Clerk In Health Information Department in Williamsville, NY
pros: Fair and equitable salaries. Wonderful work environment. Great coworkers.Managers work with employees if they are having personal or family problems that affect their jobs.
cons: The only downside of working for any healthcare facility and it is something you should know before you take the position is that coverage is needed 24 hours a day and if you take a position that includes evenings, weekends and holidays, make sure you know what you are getting into because you are expected to show up.

pros: the pay was good ,we worked together it was like a family free parking for all employer and was able to get overtime hours if posted.They also allow you to further your education with the hospital
cons: Was under union contract that stopped pay raises once you reached your 20 years of service at the hospital,high prices in the cafeteria.

review_title: Great people, unsure of corporate vision
job_title: IT Project Manager in Buffalo, NY
pros: Excellent projects to work on, extremely fast paced, wonderful group of people, decent benefits, adding more structure
cons: Many employees let go when there is already limited resources, shared resources = overworked employees. Unclear of corporate vision regarding this and in general thus adding to depressing internal culture. Adding a lot more structure - both pro/con

pros: Health insurance was good. Some of the pcas were great and made the work environment tolerable. Tim Hortons on site. Free parking
cons: Constantly short staffed, unsafe patient ratios, manager never around, don't listen to or care about employees. Immature coworkers who don't care about the patients. Seems like they will hire and keep anyone regardless of quality of work

pros: Great benefits & paid time off, coworkers are great
cons: Many layoffs/downsizing, low salaries/opportunities for raises for many employees who are non-union, but not upper management.  Certain members of upper management do not treat staff well.  Employees are overworked and expected to put in lots of unpaid overtime. We are constantly expected to do significantly more work with significantly less staff & resources.  We understand that times are tough, but management definitely needs to rethink strategy.

pros: Fantastic PTO (paid time).  Stability for most employees.
cons: Lack of trust between staff and leadership.  Too much time and money spent on projects that don't complete.

review_title: Kaleida health is a decent good paying job.
